design_audit.model_formula: PD_P2_UsageFITSBY ~ B + L + i.Stratifier + PD_P1_UsageFITSBY, robust

claim_object.outcome_concept: Daily screen time on FITSBY apps (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, Browser, YouTube) in minutes/day
claim_object.treatment_concept: Randomly assigned screen-time bonus (financial incentive to reduce use) and/or screen-time limit (commitment device)
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of bonus/limit treatments on phone usage (FITSBY apps)
claim_object.target_population: Android phone users recruited via Phone Dashboard app (2020, during COVID-19)

baseline_specs.label: Usage-P2-FITSBY-Simple
baseline_specs.notes: Simple treatment specification: B (bonus indicator = S3_Bonus) and L (any limit indicator = S2_LimitType != 0). Control for stratification dummies and baseline usage. The reg_treatment ado applies: reg yvar B L $STRATA baseline, robust.

constraints.functional_form_policy: In an RCT, controls are for precision, not identification. The baseline outcome (PD_P1_UsageFITSBY) is the primary precision control. Stratification dummies match the randomization design.
constraints.treatment_structure_note: Two orthogonal treatments: Bonus (B) and Limit (L). Both should always be included. The paper also reports specs with detailed limit types (L_1 through L_5 for different snooze options) but the simple specification is the main one.
constraints.g2_stacking_note: G2 regressions use stacked survey waves (S3/S4). The code reshapes data to long format with a survey indicator S, then includes i.S and interactions i.S#$STRATA and i.S#c.baseline_outcome. The runner must replicate this stacking structure for G2 specs.

canonical.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust HC1 SEs, matching paper's 'robust' option

design_audit.model_formula: SWBIndex_N ~ B + B4 + L + i.S + i.S#i.Stratifier + i.S#c.S1_SWBIndex_N, robust cluster(UserID)

claim_object.outcome_concept: Survey-based well-being outcomes (addiction scale, SMS addiction scale, subjective well-being, phone makes life better, ideal use change, survey index)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Randomly assigned screen-time bonus and/or screen-time limit
claim_object.estimand_concept: ITT effect of bonus/limit treatments on self-reported well-being measures
claim_object.target_population: Android phone users recruited via Phone Dashboard app (2020)

baseline_specs.label: FDRTable-SWBIndex
baseline_specs.notes: FDR Table regression: stacked survey waves (S3/S4), with B (redefined as B4 = bonus x S4 indicator), B4, L, and survey-wave interacted strata and baseline outcome. Focal parameter: coefficient on L (limit treatment effect on well-being). Code: gen B4 = B*(S==2); replace B = B4; reg yvar B B4 L i.S i.S#$STRATA i.S#c.baseline, robust cluster(UserID). Since B is replaced by B4, they are collinear and Stata drops one.

canonical.notes: Cluster at individual level for stacked panel, matching paper's cluster(UserID)

variants.notes: Robust SEs without clustering (single cross-section per survey)
